content.description: Sit start on a left pocket undercling and a right slopey sidepull.  Make a big move right to a series of pockets and pinches, and figure out the best way to match and get established (hint undercling) for a big move left to jugs and an and easy topout.
content.location: On the backside of the main part of Bleeding Brothers roof.  Hike over the roof and down into a cave.

content.description: Long traverse across mix of jugs and slopers to a mantel topout.
Start on large sloper shelf in middle of corridor. Discover how to mantle up and reach sculpted holds above to top out. Watch out for the wall behind you as you get higher.
content.location: In a corridor a few tiers above the main Mopboys wall. One suggested path would be to walk to the left end of the Mopboys wall and then trend up and back to the right.

content.description: Starts matched in the roof hueco and climb up left on jugs. Move out the roof to topout is tricky.
content.location: right side, second roof above big nose miley shelf. look for a big hueco jug inches from the lip, right of bleeding brothers.

content.description: Warm up at mop boys boulder, starts on jugs to the right of the angling crack and takes crack to the top
content.location: center of mopboys(end of mopboys traverse?)

climbs.name: Mop Boy aka Mop Buckets
climbs.fa: Matt Samet, Scott Leondard, and Pete Zoller, 12/91

content.description:
Traverse the long overhanging wall from right to left.  Sit start on Jugs behind a bush and finish left of the groove where the angle lessens.  The top while not required is easy and doesn't have too much loose rock. 

  The first 10 feet are the hardest and consist of a V4 / V5 boulder problem.  After this it is just a matter of fighting the pump, through mostly easy V0 climbing with two short V2/V3 moves.
content.protection: Pad and Spotter, the traverse is pretty low, so not much protection is needed.
content.location: The obvious long overhanging traverse.  Walkoff on either side.

content.description: Start matched on the breast shaped slopey jug.  Climb out the roof using jugs and underclings to a big move at the lip.  Catch the left hand crimp, stay tight, get the right hand crimp and pull over the lip.  Watch out for some potential to break holds while pulling the lip.
content.location: On the left side of the Bleeding Brothers roof.  Starts left of a large tree growing out of the cave.

content.description: Lowball roof climb to a pseudo topout, but excellent movement through a sea of comfy/juggy pockets.
content.location: Start deep right side of the roof and beach whale over the lip.

content.description:
Contains two main areas the Mopboys traverse wall and the Bleeding Brothers Roof.  Mopboys wall contains the classic traverse Mopboys, Bleeding brothers roof contains problems from V4 to V12. 

  Mopboys wall, gets early morning sun and shade for most of the day.  Bleeding Brothers Roof, gets early morning shade, then sun for most of the day.
